0.80.text: So Arts is a place where you can do a variety of specialist programs.

8.08.text: We like to think that we cover the whole spectrum

11.08.text: of Arts based subjects and we skill and equip our

15.88.text: students to go out and find either a career which

19.48.text: suited to their particular talents or give them

22.16.text: the tools and mechanisms to search for that career.

25.52.text: One of the great things about the Faculty is that

27.76.text: over the past four or five years we've been able to

30.64.text: restructure and renew large parts of the teaching environment.

35.24.text: With new ways of teaching in mind,

37.04.text: so that particularly at graduate level and the

39.92.text: upper levels of the Bachelor's program the focus

43.72.text: is on much more interactive learning.

45.80.text: I think one of the great strengths of the University of Melbourne

49.76.text: is how it synchronises with the wider city of which it is a part.

54.84.text: All the great cultural, outstanding cultural capacities

60.04.text: of this city breathe through the structure of the

63.32.text: Graduate School itself and of the wider University.

65.92.text: So in coming to the University of Melbourne,

67.76.text: you really are getting the full Melbourne experience

71.16.text: which many people around the world are seeking.

74.44.text: There is a sort of passionate quality about most Art Students,

80.12.text: they're here because they really really do love

82.40.text: what they're learning, but what draws them

85.04.text: to their discipline or to their area of study

88.20.text: or to their degree, is a tremendous sense of

91.08.text: enthusiasm and excitement for the field.

93.96.text: The work they do is not simply instrumental,

96.48.text: not simply about wanting to develop a skill set

99.72.text: it's also how think of their own identity

106.04.text: We give our students the best opportunity to apply their

109.40.text: theoretical knowledge in a practical environment.

113.56.text: You can walk into a first year classroom and find

116.12.text: lecturing in front of you somebody who's just

118.60.text: finished the book on that subject and is able to not only

123.16.text: give obviously a rendition of their own work,

126.08.text: but is right at the apex of world wide expertise in the field.

131.36.text: We pride ourselves on being a University

133.48.text: with a long and proud tradition but which has

136.44.text: remained at the cutting edge when it comes to

139.40.text: engagement with the wider world outside of it.

142.64.text: If your ambition is simply to hide from the world

145.80.text: this is not an appropriate place for you to be.

148.36.text: If you want to come and understand how

151.56.text: how scholars, not just contemporary ones,

153.52.text: but across history, have understood the problems

157.84.text: doing it here at Melbourne will prepare you

160.64.text: to go out into the world and to make the difference.
